title: Audrius Šlekys
text:
Audrius Šlekys (2 April 1975 - 27 July 2003) was a <a href="Lithuania">Lithuania</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Šlekys played for several clubs in his hometown <a href="Kaunas">Kaunas</a> and had spells in Russia with <a href="FC%20Alania%20Vladikavkaz">Alania Vladikavkaz</a> and <a href="FC%20Metallurg%20Lipetsk">Metallurg Lipetsk</a>. In 2002 he topped the Lithuanian goalscoring charts with 19 goals FOR <a href="FBK%20Kaunas">FBK Kaunas</a>.
International career.
He made his debut for <a href="Lithuania%20national%20football%20team">Lithuania</a> in a July 1996 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Belarus%20national%20football%20team">Belarus</a>, his only international game.
Death.
Šlekys was killed in a car accident in July 2003, after he lost control of his BMW near the village of <a href="%C5%BDieg%C5%BEdriai">Žiegždriai</a>.
